message.acc: Set up angles of incidence and angles of reflection to score a hole in one.
message.loc: Set up angles of incidence and angles of reflection to score a hole-in-one.

message.acc: Are you sure you want to reset? The angles you formed will be cleared.
message.loc: Are you sure you want to reset? The angles you formed will be cleared.

message.acc: Are you sure you want to clear all the data?
message.loc: Are you sure you want to clear all the data?

message.acc: Adjust your angle of reflection to get a hole in one.
message.loc: Adjust your angle of reflection to get a hole-in-one.

message.acc: Good Job! Now try to score a hole in one in %@$%.
message.loc: Good Job! Now try to score a hole-in-one in %@$%.

message.acc: Good Job! You have completed all the courses. You may select a previously unlocked course or try this one again.
message.loc: Good Job! You have completed all the courses. You may select a previously unlocked course or try this one again.
Please move the ball path away from the object to unlock its position.

message.acc: Choose a course. Unlock more as you go. A Scoreboard button is available to check your scores.
message.loc: Choose a course. Unlock more as you go!

message.acc: Design a path to get a hole in one.
message.loc: Design a path to get a hole-in-one.

Get a hole-in-one on
"Putt-Putt Classic" to unlock!

Get a hole-in-one on
"The Cosmos" to unlock!

Get a hole-in-one on
"Pirate's Cove" to unlock!

message.acc: Course number %@$%. Current name is %@$%. Use the arrow keys to go to a different course. Use space to play this course.
Course number %@$%, %@$% is locked. Use the arrow keys to go to a different course.

message.loc: A tutorial explaining how to play will be shown at the start of this course.

message.acc: Your scorecard is below. A Back button is provided to go back to the previous screen.
A Reset score button is also there to rest the score.
A close button is provided to close the scorecard.
Course number %@$%, %@$% has been played %@$% times. You have got %@$% holes in ones in this course.
Design a path to get a hole in one.
message.loc: Design a path to get a hole-in-one.

message.acc: Course number %@$%, %@$% is given below. The golf ball is present on the course. Its position can be changed using the arrow keys. Each time the ball collides with an obstacle, a sticky slider appears which can be used to change the angle of incidence and reflection.
%@$% obstacles are given which can be placed on the course.

A take shot button will appear when the ball is positioned over the hole. Skip animation button will appear on the screen when the shot playing animation is played. Reset button is provided to reset the course. A Scorecard button is also present. The New Course button can be used to try a new course.

message.loc: How to play Move the ball to barrier and release. Adjust the angle. Move the ball over the hole and release. Press Take Shot.
Obstacles Drag an obstacle on the course. Use obstacle to bank shot.
Move ball to barrier and release.
Move ball over hole and release.
Drag an obstacle on the course.

message.acc: Use the arrows to navigate between putting greens.
message.loc: Use the arrows to navigate between putting greens.
Select the Score Card to see your overall performance.
message.acc: Select the Score Card to check your overall performance.

message.loc: Place obstacles on the course to create new angle possibilities and help route your shot directly to the hole.
Select object and use handles to rotate object to desired orientation.
You may place more than one object on the course at a time to plan your shot.
Adjust the location of the bridge by moving it along the river.
You may bank the ball off the inside walls of the bridge supports.
To adjust the bridge, be sure the ball and any control handles are not touching the bridge.

message.acc: Refresh the putting green, and start over.
message.loc: Refresh the putting green, and start over.
Select to try with a new course.
message.acc: Select to try with new course.

message.loc: Use handles to rotate the ball desired orientation.
Drag the ball to a barrier to set up a shot.
Drag the handle to adjust where the ball hits the barrier.
Drag the ball to change the angles.
Drag the ball to the hole to get the Take Shot button. Select Take Shot to try your shot.
message.acc: Drag the ball to the hole to get the Take Shot button. Select Take Shot to try your shot.

message.loc: Carpet ball. Use arrow keys to change its position within the carpet. Use the r or e keys to rotate it clockwise or anticlockwise respectively.
Current ball. Use the arrow keys to change its position.
Current ball is over the hole. Take shot button is available. Use tab to go to the Take Shot button and try your shot.
Angle of incidence is %@$%  degrees and angle of reflection is %@$% degrees.
Angle of incidence is 1 degree and angle of reflection is %@$% degrees.
Angle of incidence is %@$% degrees and angle of reflection is 1 degree.
Use the arrow keys to change its position and space to set new position. Use delete button to delete this slider.
New angle of incidence is %@$% degrees and angle of reflection is %@$% degrees.
New angle of incidence is 1 degree and angle of reflection is %@$% degrees.
New angle of incidence is %@$% degrees and angle of reflection is 1 degree.
%@$% course. A main ball is present which is the starting position of the golf ball. Rotation handles are present on the main ball which can be used to change its orientation.
Sticky sliders are present on the points of collisions.
There is an obstacle on the course. %@$% obstacles have been added to the course.
A bridge is also present which can be shifted along the river if no sticky sliders are present on it and it doesn’t cross the ball’s path. Use space to enter the course.
Use space to enter the course.
Use the arrow key to move it. Use space to set its position.
Use delete button to remove the obstacle.
Obstacle %@$%  has been placed on the course.
Use tab to go to the next obstacle.
Use the r or e keys to rotate it clockwise or anticlockwise respectively.
Bridge. Use the arrow keys to shift the bridge along the river and space to set its position.
